title.narrative: WASH BEHAVIOURAL CHANGE

description.narrative: Children and their families have improved knowledge on safe healthy behaviors for hygiene, sanitation, and water conservation, particularly in the most vulnerable districts., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children aged 6-17 access timely and quality early childhood education, basic and post-basic education in humanitarian situations in Iraq

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and their families have improved knowledge on safe healthy behaviors for hygiene, sanitation, and water conservation,particularly in the most vulnerable districts.

description.narrative: Over 282,687 individuals were reached and/ or engaged through interventions on water conservation and hygiene awareness on cholera prevention, other water related diseases and campaigns on hand-washing with soap, community engagement , piloting MHM for adolescent girls from 20 schools, IDPs and refugees (51% female) in institutions, communities and camps. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2019
